page.title: 01Little Steeping Fens to SW
page.content: Most of the area is drained fen. The northern edge is slightly higher glacial drift. Fenlands are almost entirely arable. Cereal crops dominate but potatoes and brassicas are also important. The grasslands on the drift soils at Little Steeping and Toynton support cattle and sheep. Around Toynton and Steeping fields are small hedges some rich in species and of gratage but fenland fields are large and hedgeless. Fenland farms are large and highly mechanised the mixed farms are small family units. The peat soils on the fens are eroding rapidly. Straw burning is almmost universal on cereal fields causing many complaints. In recent years by laws controlling burning have been adhered to but nuisance persists.Low house prices have attracted retired people nd second homes but lack of public
